Lack enough support: The claim lacks any evidence to support the assertion that the explosion was related to an investigation into the Clinton Foundation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the victims of the explosion were due to testify against Hillary Clinton without any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that investigators found no evidence of foul play and ruled the deaths as accidental.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the explosion by tying it to a conspiracy theory involving the Clintons, without any evidence to support this connection.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on unreliable sources and websites known for spreading false news.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the explosion and jumps to the conclusion of a conspiracy involving the Clintons.
